page.title: 06Rochford Hall
page.content: Rochford Hall was built in the 1530's. It was built out of Tudor bricks which are smaller than modern day bricks. The ceiling is made of massive oak beams which are in excellent condition. Rochford Hall's ceilings are about 12 ft high. In 1509 Henry VIII ruled over England, and took Anne Boleyn to be his wife. Anne Boleyn's father owned Rochford Hall at the time and so Henry often joined the hunting parties. There used to be 8 towers, 4 on the outside and 4 on the inside. There is a oak spiral stair case which has been there ever since Rochford Hall's been there. Parts of the manor have been burnt down. Nowadays the house and it's grounds are used as a Golf Club. It has been going since 1893 and has got 800 members, 650 of whom play golf.
